meanings.definition: To change or transform in a surprising or magical manner.
meanings.sent1: The wizard was transmogrifying a pumpkin into a carriage.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar transmogrified into a beautiful butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat kept transmogrifying into different animals, much to the audience's delight.
meanings.sent4: Her voice transmogrified the room into a realm of pure emotion.
meanings.sent5: The potion had the power of transmogrifying ordinary objects into precious gems.

meanings.definition: To alter or modify in a strange or grotesque way.
meanings.sent1: The artist was transmogrifying the painting with unusual colors.
meanings.sent2: The nightmare transmogrified the peaceful dream into a scene of horror.
meanings.sent3: The Halloween costume party had everyone transmogrifying into spooky characters.
meanings.sent4: The once beautiful garden was transmogrified into a twisted, eerie landscape.
meanings.sent5: The old mirror seemed to be transmogrifying the reflection into a distorted figure.
